fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32972].
  {panel}

When viewing a space, the Child Pages section of the sidebar will list child pages if any. However, if there are no child pages, a cue of sorts to let the user know about sibling pages would be helpful

h5.Example (taken from a real support case)

# As part of a recovery procedure, a temporary space was created.
# Recovered pages were inserted into the space - but not as children of the home page
# The space administrator was able to see all the pages being updated, but because he didn't see any child pages in the sidebar, he was not able to find the pages themselves (to move them, etc).

h5.Isn't there a "Browse and Re-order screen"?

Yes, but it's buried inside the space administration, and requires several clicks to get there:

# Click "Space Tools"
# Click "Content Tools
# Click "Reorder Pages"

h5.How to Improve
A "Show All" link next to the "Pages" tree menu (or at the very least in the vicinity), which would link to the "Browse and Reorder" screen. This link would only appear for users who have the permissions to view the space administration screen. 

h5.What is gained?
* Better adoption of spaces and hierarchies
* Less "where did my page go?" issues
* Greater space administrator awareness of the content within a space - less orphaned pages
fields.summary: Allow the user to view all pages within a space

fields.description:
We currently ship Confluence with Tomcat 6, but the default connector still references maxProcessors. This attribute was deprecated in Tomcat 5.5 and no longer exists in Tomcat 6. 

Instead, to control the number of threads that the application can use, you need to specify maxThreads.

References:
http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-5.5-doc/config/ajp.html
http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-6.0-doc/config/http.html
http://grokbase.com/t/tomcat/users/065aw5k4a8/maxthreads-compared-to-maxprocessors

Default connector:
{code}
<Connector className="org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector" port="10542" 
      minProcessors="5" maxProcessors="75"
      enableLookups="false" redirectPort="8443" acceptCount="10" debug="0" connectionTimeout="20000"
      useURIValidationHack="false" URIEncoding="UTF-8"/>
{code}
fields.summary: server.xml contains incorrect parameters for threads in the default connector

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32965].
  {panel}

In the OD edition of Confluence connected to MSSQL 2012, the reorder pages screen doesn't display any of the child pages of the space.

h3.Steps to Reproduce

1. Install 5.4-OD-5 with MSSQL 2012
2. Create a space with child pages
3. Navigate to Space Admin > Content Tools > Reorder Pages
4. Screen is blank (see screenshot)
5. The following error is thrown in the logs:

{code}
2014-03-17 18:43:18,294 ERROR [http-bio-8090-exec-15] [opensymphony.xwork.util.CompoundRootAccessor] getProperty Caught an Ognl exception while getting property JSONString
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/pages/reorderpages.action?key=ds | url: /pages/children.action | userName: admin | action: children | space: 65537
ognl.OgnlException: JSONString [org.springframework.dao.TransientDataAccessResourceException: Hibernate operation: Could not execute query; SQL []; Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'is'.; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'is'.]
...
org.springframework.dao.TransientDataAccessResourceException: Hibernate operation: Could not execute query; SQL []; Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'is'.; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'is'.
{code}

Confluence is trying to execute the following query, which fails due to a syntax error in the ORDER BY clause:

{code:sql}
select page0_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID, page0_.CHILD_POSITION as CHILD_P13_, page0_.PARENTID as PARENTID, page0_.SPACEID as SPACEID, page0_.TITLE as TITLE, page0_.VERSION as VERSION, page0_.CREATOR as CREATOR, page0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_, page0_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI7_, page0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD8_, page0_.VERSIONCOMMENT as VERSIONC9_, page0_.PREVVER as PREVVER, page0_.CONTENT_STATUS as CONTENT11_ from CONTENT page0_ 
where page0_.CONTENTTYPE='PAGE' and ((page0_.PARENTID is null )and(page0_.PREVVER is null )and(page0_.SPACEID=65537 )and(page0_.CONTENT_STATUS='current' )) 
order by  page0_.CHILD_POSITION is null , page0_.CHILD_POSITION , page0_.TITLE
{code}

fields.description:
Raising this on behalf of a support request.

When a page is being edited by pressing E or clicking the Edit button, the HTML <title> tag does not automatically change to "Edit - <page name>". The content in the title tag is what gets displayed in browser tabs.

However if one right-clicks the Edit button and opens the editor in a new page, or refreshes an existing page showing the editor, the <title> tag is correctly updated to show "Edit - <page name>".

The customer's use case is that having the "Edit" text in the browser tab is useful to quickly identify which tab contains the editor when there are many Confluence pages open in the user's browser.
fields.summary: The <title> element in <head> does not change when page is being edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32938].
  {panel}

When Confluence and JIRA are set within the same database in different schemas, triggering the upgrade task will detect duplicate primary keys.

The task interprets the separate tables as s single one and halts the upgrade task. 

{quote}
h5. Current
Current queries are written to directly access the system catalog rather than information_schema. Here is one query from the log along with the result it returns, pertaining to the 'label' table:
internal_tools=# SELECT NULL AS TABLE_CAT, n.nspname AS TABLE_SCHEM, c.relname AS TABLE_NAME, CASE n.nspname ~ '^pg_' OR n.nspname = 'information_schema' WHEN true THEN CASE WHEN n.nspname = 'pg_catalog' OR n.nspname = 'information_schema' THEN CASE c.relkind WHEN 'r' THEN 'SYSTEM TABLE' WHEN 'v' THEN 'SYSTEM VIEW' WHEN 'i' THEN 'SYSTEM INDEX' ELSE NULL END WHEN n.nspname = 'pg_toast' THEN CASE c.relkind WHEN 'r' THEN 'SYSTEM TOAST TABLE' WHEN 'i' THEN 'SYSTEM TOAST INDEX' ELSE NULL END ELSE CASE c.relkind WHEN 'r' THEN 'TEMPORARY TABLE' WHEN 'i' THEN 'TEMPORARY INDEX' WHEN 'S' THEN 'TEMPORARY SEQUENCE' WHEN 'v' THEN 'TEMPORARY VIEW' ELSE NULL END END WHEN false THEN CASE c.relkind WHEN 'r' THEN 'TABLE' WHEN 'i' THEN 'INDEX' WHEN 'S' THEN 'SEQUENCE' WHEN 'v' THEN 'VIEW' WHEN 'c' THEN 'TYPE' WHEN 'f' THEN 'FOREIGN TABLE' ELSE NULL END ELSE NULL END AS TABLE_TYPE, d.description AS REMARKS FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n, pg_catalog.pg_class c LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_description d ON (c.oid = d.objoid AND d.objsubid = 0) LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class dc ON (d.classoid=dc.oid AND dc.relname='pg_class') LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace dn ON (dn.oid=dc.relnamespace AND dn.nspname='pg_catalog') WHERE c.relnamespace = n.oid AND c.relname LIKE 'label' AND (false OR ( c.relkind = 'r' AND n.nspname !~ '^pg_' AND n.nspname <> 'information_schema' ) ) ORDER BY TABLE_TYPE,TABLE_SCHEM,TABLE_NAME;

table_cat | table_schem | table_name | table_type | remarks

-----------+-------------+------------+------------+---------

           | confluence  | label      | TABLE      |

           | jira        | label      | TABLE      |

(2 rows)

h5. Proposed
the query should include a {{pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)}} clause.  Here is the same query with that added, run as the app_confluence user:

internal_tools=> SELECT NULL AS TABLE_CAT, n.nspname AS TABLE_SCHEM, c.relname AS TABLE_NAME,  CASE n.nspname ~ '^pg_' OR n.nspname = 'information_schema'  WHEN true THEN CASE  WHEN n.nspname = 'pg_catalog' OR n.nspname = 'information_schema' THEN CASE c.relkind   WHEN 'r' THEN 'SYSTEM TABLE'   WHEN 'v' THEN 'SYSTEM VIEW'   WHEN 'i' THEN 'SYSTEM INDEX'   ELSE NULL   END  WHEN n.nspname = 'pg_toast' THEN CASE c.relkind   WHEN 'r' THEN 'SYSTEM TOAST TABLE'   WHEN 'i' THEN 'SYSTEM TOAST INDEX'   ELSE NULL   END  ELSE CASE c.relkind   WHEN 'r' THEN 'TEMPORARY TABLE'   WHEN 'i' THEN 'TEMPORARY INDEX'   WHEN 'S' THEN 'TEMPORARY SEQUENCE'   WHEN 'v' THEN 'TEMPORARY VIEW'   ELSE NULL   END  END  WHEN false THEN CASE c.relkind  WHEN 'r' THEN 'TABLE'  WHEN 'i' THEN 'INDEX'  WHEN 'S' THEN 'SEQUENCE'  WHEN 'v' THEN 'VIEW'  WHEN 'c' THEN 'TYPE'  WHEN 'f' THEN 'FOREIGN TABLE'  ELSE NULL  END  ELSE NULL  END  AS TABLE_TYPE, d.description AS REMARKS  FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n, pg_catalog.pg_class c  LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_description d ON (c.oid = d.objoid AND d.objsubid = 0)  LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class dc ON (d.classoid=dc.oid AND dc.relname='pg_class')  LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace dn ON (dn.oid=dc.relnamespace AND dn.nspname='pg_catalog')  WHERE c.relnamespace = n.oid  AND c.relname LIKE 'label' AND (false  OR ( c.relkind = 'r' AND n.nspname !~ '^pg_' AND n.nspname <> 'information_schema' ) ) and pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)  ORDER BY TABLE_TYPE,TABLE_SCHEM,TABLE_NAME;

table_cat | table_schem | table_name | table_type | remarks

-----------+-------------+------------+------------+---------

           | confluence  | label      | TABLE      |

(1 row)

Alternatively they could add the suggested clause to their query, which is how the psql command-line tool works.
{quote}
fields.summary: Add support for Confluence to read different schemas in a single Postgres database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32934].
  {panel}

As a Confluence user who has started automatically watching a page after editing it, I want to have intuitive and straight-forward user experience for stopping watching that page.

h4. Current State
Currently there are on the upper right corner of page set of controls (see attached image) that clearly and visibly lets user know that it is possible to perform following functions:
* Edit
* Watch 
* Share
* Tools _(this one has visual indicator that lets me know, that i may fold open some kind of menu)_

*Note that there is no visual indicator, that pressing _Watch_ opens something as well!*

h4. Better Solution
In order to address this problem you may improve UX in several ways:
* Add little indicator next to watch button, that hints about possibility to fold open some kind of menu.
* Change watch icon to be enabled/disabled for pages that are either watched or not. For example this "eye" could turn red inside when page is being watched (kind of like the eye of Sauron from the LOTR)
* Change label from _Watch_ to _Stop watching_ or _Manage watches_
* Make a little check mark in the "eye" to indicate that user is watching the page and to encourage user to click there, in case he/she wants to stop watching that page
* Have your UX engineer come up with even better solution

_Disclaimer_ This is not support issue, as I already figured out, that:
*In order to _stop watching_ I have to click _watch_* -- fortunately MS taught us, that in order to turn off computer you have to click _start_ ;)
fields.summary: Improve "Stop Watcing" UX

fields.description:
I can type a certain amount of text into a Confluence Comment field in response to an article posted there. At a certain point near the bottom of the text area box I can no longer see what I type. Each press of the keyboard will jump the display of text down then auto-scroll back up so that I can't see what I typed. This forces me to use an external tool to type up my full comment and then copy/paste it into the Comment box in Confluence... a pain. At that point I still don't see all the text. If I arrow down to the text  that is out of sight, it jumps down for a split second then auto-scrolls back up, hiding the display of that lower text. If I Preview the comment I then see it's all there. I can post the comment and it's all there. But in edit mode, it's broken. There needs to be a scroll bar for oversized text content and a grow-box-size handle in the bottom right corner of the Comment text box to increase the box size displayed.

I made a screen capture movie of this issue in action. Hope this helps illustrate the issue: http://screencast.com/t/r4e17crdacc

h4. Workaround
Uninstall the "Confluence browser fixes" plugin or "Confluence editor height fix" plugin from versions that already have these fixes bundled.
fields.summary: Typing into a Confluence Comment limits the amount of text I see

Whenever I have a template / blueprint with a JIRA issue macro I want to predefine what columns should be displayed and how many issues will be shown.
Behaviour right now: 
* In the blueprint / template a jira issue macro has been set.
* when creating a new page and clicking on the instructional text for the jira issue macro, the create jira issue dialog opens. There standard values will be displayed. Always: 
* Maximum issues: 20
* Columns to display: Key, Summary, Issue Type, Created, Updated, Due Date, Assignee, Reporter, Priority, Status, Resolution


Wanted behaviour:
* In the blueprint or template a user can choose how many issues will be returned by default and what columns should be displayed. 
** Example: Maximum issues: 100
** Columns to display: Key, Summary, Status, Resolution


My use case:
I create a product requirement where a requirement has 2 EPICs. As soon as I insert two Epics - I do not want to use 2 jira issue macros - I get a table with predefined columns. However, I only really need these Columns displayed: Key, Summary, Status, Resolution. Because in the requirements document I really don't need more information...
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro standard column configuration

fields.description:
I have two application links to two JIRA instances: my test JIRA (Localhost JIRA) and the company's JIRA. I created both application links, made the company's application link the primary one.

However, when I open the JIRA issue macro the wrong JIRA application link is selected, at least it seems so. However, when I excute a search, the search is triggered in the correct JIRA. I think the labels / names are not correctly set.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro shows wrong application link name, but searches in the correct application

fields.description:
A colleague pasted some excel tables into Confluence and it worked fantastic. Only problem some tables display the edges (inside and ouside borders), and some tables doesn't display any border. 
There is no option to display or not the borders.
How can we fix this?
fields.summary: table borders

fields.description:

I saved this by finding the page through my personal space / profile and looking for a draft. Now I chose the correct move.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32909].
  {panel}

This will help to administer who has access to a space with what permission.

The rows would indicate the spaces, the columns would indicate the space permissions.

If a permission to space is provided via a group then it is displayed with a group icon.
If a permission to space is provided to the user directly then it is displayed with a user icon.
if the permission was not granted for the space then it is displayed with a red cross.
fields.summary: What about having an admin user management screen similar to the JIRA user project role?

fields.description:
When copy and pasting any links that have a reference to a user profile, after saving we get "user undefined" message popup for user.

I believe the best solution for this would be for the EditorLinkUnmarshaller to handle all links, and to strip the userlink-0 classes out, since they are not appropriate to be stored in storage format.
fields.summary: "User undefined" popup message after pasting user links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32906].
{panel}
When creating JIRA issues on Confluence, only support:
 System fields
 Custom fields which have these field types such textfield, textarea, URL, number (ie Epic name, Epic Link).

In this ticket we will support JIRA custom field - select list (single choice) if this is required field to input when creating JIRA issues.
fields.summary: Can't create JIRA issues from Confluence if a mandatory custom filed has types textfield,textarea,number etc
Confluence 5.3 using Synchronous XMLHttpRequest

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32903].
  {panel}

Confluence does not provided essential library such as MySQL connector {{jra}} file out of the box. This make users need to add it manually before they install Confluence.

It shouldn't be a problem for standalone as the installation directory is available before they start Confluence. However it is not the case for *installer* version of Confluence.

In installer version, the installation directory will not be available until the installer successfully deploy Confluence. Hence user will need to restart Confluence after it started to applied the necessary library file.

*Implementation Suggestion*

Installer version should provide a feature where it could ask user to upload the necessary library *before* it *start* Confluence. Hence, it is not necessary to restart Confluence to applied the library and a streamline process could be achieve for the users installing Confluence using installer method.
fields.summary: Upload Library to Confluence Installation Directory Through Installer

fields.description:
In the attached screenshot 10.42.15, notice that the entire contents of the Attachments macro is underlined. This seems to happen if a Viewfile macro for a Word document is placed on the same page.

In addition, the "browse for files" link to upload a file in the Attachments macro no longer works. The file does seem to get uploaded, but the spinner remains on the page forever and the page never refreshes.

To reproduce:

# Create a new page in a space
# Add the testdoc.docx attachment (included here just in case, although it seems that any Word doc will do).
# Edit the page again to add a viewfile macro.
# Add an Attachments macro (or anything else) *after* the viewfile macro.
# Notice that all of the text on the page is turned into a link with hover-underlines (see the attached underline.mov for an example).

It appears that the Word Viewfile macro somehow causes a new "<a name="_GoBack">' tag to be inserted around content on the page, including the attachments macro, even though that content resides outside of the frame of the viewfile macro. See screenshot 10.40.33.

As mentioned above, this also breaks the "browse for files" to upload feature in the Attachments macro. After attempting the upload, I get the following errors in the JS console (from com.atlassian.auiplugin:aui-header):

{code}
TypeError: menuItems[i] is undefined
remaining -= menuItems[i].itemWidth;
batch.js (line 17127)

TypeError: menuItems[i] is undefined
remaining -= menuItems[i].itemWidth;
batch.js (line 17127)
{code}
fields.summary: Word Viewfile macro breaks "browse for files" to upload and causes other page content to be rendered as links

fields.description:
This is for the internal bug CONFDEV-15413 since I noticed there was no public one tracking this issue.

h3. Summary

A page with many watchers will thrash a system's performance by processing/reprocessing mail content for the hundreds of watchers:

{code}

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce

*Scenario 1*
Unable to disable Space Template with non System Administrator user.
# Log in to Confluence using a user without System Administrator permission in Confluence
#  Configured the Space with documentation theme.
#  Disable the template

*Expected Result*
The blue print for the particular space is disabled.


*Observed Result*
Even if the user click the disable button for the template nothing occur.


*Scenario 2*
Disabling the Space Template with System Administrator disable the global Template as well
# Log in to Confluence using a user with System Administrator permission in Confluence
#  Configured the Space with documentation theme.
#  Disable the template

*Expected Result*
The blue print for the particular space is disabled.

*Observed Result*
All the same template are disable in all spaces and Global Template.






As you can see both the Global Template is disable as well once the administrator disable the template in a space with documentation theme.
!global_template.png|width=400,height=400! !space_template.png|width=400,height=400!


This bug does not occur if the user is using default theme in the space.
fields.summary: Unable to disable Space Template in Documentation theme with non System Administrator user.

fields.description:
Since a view days I'm not not longer able to access the adminstration page within my confluence installation. I use openldap in combination with a basic authentication in the apache webserver to authenticate the user upfront. The problem appeared from one day to the other without changing the configuration within ldap or confluence. The confluence log file doesn't show any obvious error messes or exceptions. The user I want to use is the admin user I created during the setup process. Furthermore, the user is in the group 'confluence-administrators' in ldap.

I'm also using JIRA and over there the group membership from LDAP is applied succcessfully and I'm able to access the administration page with the same user.

*My Setup*
- Ubuntu Server 12.04
- Confluence 5.4.2
- Tomcat 6
- Apache Webserver 2.2
- Openldap 2.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32885].
  {panel}

Right now if a user creates an account on the signup screen it auto logs them in and brings them back to the homepage, which is great.

It would be even better though if the user got a message confirming that their account was successfully been created and that they are now logged in, with a button to go to the homepage.

Users seem to get lost and not realize their account creation was successful and that they are logged in.

Sending an email confirming the account creation was part of this process change would also be a big improvement.

fields.description:
h4.Problem:
When JIRA 6.1.3 integrate Confluence 5.4.1 using *OAuth* authentication, Confluence Activity Gadget will keep request approve button for an user to access even though already allowing the gadget to read and update data. It seem the OAuth authentication is not working for external gadgets and no errors being thrown out from the logs.

h4.Steps to reproduce:
# Configure an application link only use OAuth authentication.
# Add a Confluence Activity gadget in JIRA.
# Press the Login & Approve button and click allow.
# Back to the dashboard showing the same Login & Approve button again.
# After click for a few times, it success. 
# Then, try to refresh the Activity Stream but back to the same problem.

Temporary Workaround:
* Use JIRA Activity Stream gadget
* Enabled Trusted Application authentication on both applications
fields.summary: Confluence Activity Gadget keep prompt Login & Approve button after click Allow for a few times

fields.description:
When a user searches for an attachment that contain spaces the macro will work fine, however if he click on that attachment it will result in a page not find error.
!pagenotfound.PNG!

h4.Steps to reproduce:
# Create a space and attach the to it the files "nospace.doc" and "with space.doc".
# Now create a new page and add the Live Search Macro.
# Search for the "nospace.doc", and click on it.
# File will open fine.
# Go back to the page where you added the Live Search Macro and search for the "with space.doc"
# You will get the page not found error.

h4.Workaround:
If you remove spaces in the name of the attachment you will be able to open it using live search macro.

h4.Notes:

If you go to Confluence Search Page and search for the attachment this will be the URL you will get:
{code}
http://localhost:8090/download/attachments/1540098/with%20space.doc?version=1&modificationDate=1394227894728&api=v2 
{code}
However when opening the file with Live Search Macro you will get below one in return:
{code}
http://localhost:8090/download/attachments/1540098/with%2520space.doc?version=1&modificationDate=1394227894728&api=v2
{code}

For some reason when using Live Search Macro the "%20" get replaced with "%2520"
fields.summary: Live Search Macro fails to open attachments that contain spaces in the name.
Pasting code to Code Macro hangs Chrome & FF browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32867].
  {panel}

In corporate settings with many non-public spaces it would be helpful to be able to delegate the management of group memberships to space admins in order to relieve confluence-admins of this task.

Example:
Spaces: X, Y
Groups: X-admins, X-developers, X-users, Y-admins, Y-developers, Y-users

As it is, only confluence-admins can edit membership in all three groups.

It would be better to be able to assign membership-edit privileges regarding X-developers and X-users to the members of X-admins and those regarding Y-developers and Y-users to the members of Y-admins. 
That way, confluence-admins would only need to create the groups and assign privileges once and the space admins could do the rest.

It is, of course, possible to assign individual privileges to users per space, but using groups is much superior when a lot of users are involved.
fields.summary: Delegate group membership management to space admins

Best Regards.
Marco Barbaro

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# On a fresh installation of 5.2.3, create a space.
# Export the space as XML.
# On a fresh installation of 5.2.5, attempt to import the space.
# Confirm the following error message (or similar): is shown: {{Restore denied. Your export is too old to be imported in this version of Confluence (Build Number 4353 instead of 4208).}}

h3. Other Information:
# Check the build number inside the export's exportDescriptor.properties file is 4208, while the createdByBuildNumber is 4394
# Check that {{select * from confversion}} returns 4394
# Check that confluence.cfg.xml contains 4394 as the build number.

The export cannot be imported into version 5.2.5, and 5.3.1.

When attempting to import the space from 5.2.5, you receive the following messages in the logs:

{code}2014-03-07 16:00:44,947 INFO [http-8091-2] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] getOldestSpaceImportAllowed Compatibility of Space Import: Checking...
2014-03-07 16:00:44,948 INFO [http-8091-2] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] getOldestSpaceImportAllowed Compatibility of Space Import: 4379 Upgrade task "Remove duplicate rows from UserInfo table" - Ok
2014-03-07 16:00:44,949 INFO [http-8091-2] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] getOldestSpaceImportAllowed Compatibility of Space Import: 4373 Upgrade task "Persists the installation date of the Confluence instance into the application configuration file." - Ok
2014-03-07 16:00:44,950 INFO [http-8091-2] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] getOldestSpaceImportAllowed Compatibility of Space Import: 4372 Upgrade task "Delete 'Did You Mean' index folder." - Ok
2014-03-07 16:00:44,952 INFO [http-8091-2] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] getOldestSpaceImportAllowed Compatibility of Space Import: 4357 Upgrade task "Upgrade to build number: 4357" - Ok
2014-03-07 16:00:44,953 INFO [http-8091-2] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] getOldestSpaceImportAllowed Compatibility of Space Import: 4356 Upgrade task "Rebuild the Confluence index" - Ok
2014-03-07 16:00:44,954 INFO [http-8091-2] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] getOldestSpaceImportAllowed Compatibility of Space Import: 4355 Upgrade task "Migrate legacy username-based user preferences to the new userkey-based format" - Ok
2014-03-07 16:00:44,955 INFO [http-8091-2] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] getOldestSpaceImportAllowed Compatibility of Space Import: 4353 Upgrade task "Change all username references across the tables to be user key references." prevents importing{code}
fields.summary: Space XML Export from 5.2.3 cannot be imported into 5.2.5 or above

fields.description: I uncovered this while debugging this test. It's testing a security bug where usernames have filepaths in them. Turns out you can't even create a user with a '/' in it in Active Directory
fields.summary: Usernames with forward slashes don't work in Active Directory

fields.description:
h2. Problem summary
Disabling in-app notifications (or the underlying Workbox plugins) will cause the JIRA Issue dialog to break in a few ways. This seems to be a regression of CONF-30822, originally fixed in 5.4.0

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Set up Confluence 5.4.2 with an application link to a JIRA instance
# {{Confluence Admin > In-App notifications}}, and choose to disable in-app notifications
# Add/edit a page and perform the following two tests:
## Click the Insert (+) sign and select JIRA Issue. *Problem 1: Observe "No Macro Metadata" error*. Cancel out of this.
## Start typing {jir and press enter to bring up the JIRA Issues panel. *Problem 2: Observe that the sidebar and insert buttons missing*
 
I was also able to reproduce this in 5.4.3.

h2. Workaround
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/No+Macro+Metadata+When+Trying+To+Insert+JIRA+Issue+Macro

h2. Resolution
This issue is fixed in [JIRA Macros 5.5.2|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.jira], which is compatible with Confluence 5.4 and above. The fix will be bundled in Confluence 5.5.
fields.summary: Insert JIRA Issues dialog missing sidebar or displaying "No Macro Metadata" error

fields.description:
1. Create a Page
2. Type a title containing semicolon, e.g. "Confluence: a Bug"
3. Save the page
4. Edit the page
5. Upload an attachment, e.g. a PDF or a .pptx file
6. Try to embedd the attached file via macro: the dropdown menu does not report the file as a candidate

If you go back and change the title by removing the semicolon, then save, then edit, you will be able to embedd the fle via Macro.

Possibly a bug concerning the  path of the attachment in its last part (parent page).
fields.summary: Semicolon in Page title causes attachments not be embeddable
